website_summaries.verdict: GPS and fast shooting performance make the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 a worthy rugged point-and-shoot even if its photos and videos aren't the sharpest.
pros: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 is a fast-shooting, easy-to-use rugged compact camera with excellent features to justify its high price
cons: The TS3's photos and movies look soft

customer_reviews.title: Well... it's very nice, but I haven't really done much with it!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't thrown it around to test its ruggedness. I haven't taken it underwater to test it's "waterproof-ness." The only thing I've done is take pictures of random stuff not even related to the reason I bought the camera in the first place! I pretty much only bought a waterproof camera "just in case" I go tubing this summer, which didn't happen. This actually wasn't my first choice... I returned the other one to RITZ and bought this Panasonic because Ikelite makes a waterproof case, good for 200 ft (60m)... Plenty deep for recreational SCUBA diving, for which I've wanted a camera a while!! The GPS thing is pretty accurate. Maybe one day that will be useful.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera for our trip to Hawaii, and on the VERY FIRST DAY it broken down. We followed all instructions to the letter, took it to ONE snorkeling outing, shot a couple dozens photos, and by the time we got back for lunch and tried to look at the pictures the camera would no longer turn on. It's blinking on and off an error message on the screen, and then it shuts down. Unbelieveable. Perhaps we got REALLY UNLUCKY but I don't believe in luck. I simply do not believe this camera is water proof - AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Bought it when it just came out so it was a bit pricey. Because of the price I added the 2year protection plan... didn't need it. Very happy with this rugged point-and-shoot camera. Did great while swimming in the ocean or even in the pool; just need to remember to rinse it out per instructions. Dropped it a few times when trying to pull it out of my pant pocket for that quick shot of something, but no issues/damage. I even use it for weddings and parties when I don't want to use a full size camera. Good HD video quality. Wait for a sale.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: waterproof and good picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Need a waterproofie, and this is the best, I think. I see lots of other folks with it, so I'm not alone in that opinion. Nice options, good color quality. It took some doing to find how to put the shutter speed on unlimited (like it stays open as long as you hold the button down), but I eventually found that too. Menu isn't the most intuitive, but it's got all the features once you learn where they are. Totally recommendable.
customer_reviews.author: tamarinera

customer_reviews.title: Died 15 minutes after being in 1 foot of water
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the pictures and used the camera above water for 2 years. however, I decided to take a chance and use it on my vacation to Belize while snorkeling the barrier reef. WIthin 15 minutes, I got an error message and then it just went black. When I got to land, I let the camera dry on the outside as instructed. When I opened the compartment there was water inside. I took out the SD and battery and put the camera in a bag of rice. However, I was unable to resuscitate it for the remainder of my trip and I had no backup camera. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LRB

customer_reviews.title: Reliable durable rugged little camera
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars across the board because I’ve had it for almost 10 years- it’s dropped off of waterfalls with me, swam in the ocean, it’s been rafting and bounced off of rocks and it still works! The image/video quality isn’t high end but it keeps going and fits in my pocket - I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera that can hold a beating.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera that can hold a beating and can dive. However, the quality of the pictures is not great After using it over a year I have 2 big complains: The video sound is horrible! The location of they mic is on top so good luck getting nice volume on the video. The second is the location of the lens: usually gets dirty with my fingers and get blurry pictures. Requires constant cleaning If I had to do it again probably wouldn't buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great rugged camera, perfect for vacations!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my DMC-TS3 after reading great reviews, and I'm very happy to say that I love this little camera! I took it with me to the Caribbean last week on its maiden voyage and it performed wonderfully. Great crisp and bright photos, beautiful video, performs really well underwater, fun modes and settings, and good battery life. Pretty much all the things I'd want from a digital point and shoot that I can literally grab and take with me anywhere without worry! I can tell I'm going to be getting much more use out of this little guy than my digital SLR. Buy from this user for the best price I've seen anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera!!! It's rugged and takes great pix and vid! Of course, I could use my cell phone, but when I can take this camera with me and take underwater pix and throw it in the bottom of the boat and get mud on it and wipe it off and it still performs great... thumbs up here!
customer_reviews.author: Bucktrot

customer_reviews.title: Nice rugged camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked for me on the beach; not worried about water/sand, though I did not take it underwater for the real test. I found the case recommendation in "Frequently bought together" to be wrong; why can't Amazon get this right for cameras? The Case Logic DCB-302 fits nicely and has room for the brush you use to clean the seal around the battery compartment.Of course, this is not a D-SLR and the LCD screen can be washed out in bright sunlight; in those regards it is similar to other compact camera.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Warranty Service
customer_reviews.text: The camera stopped working after about an hour, the first time I took it snorkeling. I had carefully checked to make sure it was properly closed according to the instructions. I returned it to the Panasonic Warranty center per their instructions. About two weeks later Panasonic called to tell me the camera was not covered by the warranty because they found corrosion in it. The corrosion was probably from water getting through the seal. They would not let me speak to a Supervisor or revisit their decision on refusing the warranty but offered to replace it for only $210. What is the purpose of a warranty on a supposed waterproof camera if they do not cover leakage?
customer_reviews.author: rong2789

customer_reviews.title: GREAT underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife a few years ago, and it still works great. The display on the LCD screen has a slight lag, but the pictures always come out beautiful. i have dropped the camera a few times, and the resulting damage is only a few dings here and there. I've taken it swimming and snorkeling, and never had any problems with this this. DEFINITELY recommend picking up a foam flaoting strap with this thing in case you drop it underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Beach

customer_reviews.title: Still Works Great After Nearly Four Years
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been to Hawaii twice (once by me and once loaned out), to Florida, and pools all over the midwest. It still works amazingly well and has been dropped quite a few times. The waterproofing is excellent! The only thing is it sometimes is a bit slow to start focusing and you have to tap the shutter halfway a few times to get it to work. But the photo quality is great and with a toddler it is small enough and durable for every day photos.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B Callaway

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Recently I was going on a cruise and wanted a camera which I could use around and underwater. I looked and researched days and days and finally settled on this camera. Boy am I glad I purchased this product. I do not have one complaint about this purchase. Took awesome pictures and video, highly durable, great underwater, this is just an all around great camera for use in almost any situation. My only advice is to follow the cleaning instruction carefully to keep the camera in perfect working condition. Two Thumbs up!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Could've been good - but ...
customer_reviews.text: As a rugged camera this isn't too bad. It ticks all of the boxes for specifications and its relatively easy to use. It was unfortunate for me though that I gave it to some guy who took photos under water and must've mistakenly opened it. Anyway, Panasonic didn't want to know about it (quoting me US$184 to repair it), and 2 months after buying it I am now left with an expensive paper weight. Looks like the locking mechanism has some design issues. You be the judge - I'm going back to Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Dagg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and takes wonderful photos...
customer_reviews.text: I already own the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS8 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 16x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom, but I needed camera that was waterproof for travel. Since I was already use to the controls on my camera, I opted to go with the Panasonic for my waterproof camera too. I have used the camera on 2 trips in water environments and the photos I took were excellent. As other reviewers have mentioned turn off the GPS to maximize your battery life. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: W. Raffel

customer_reviews.title: Only bad thing is fog.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice camera! I used it underwater and it was amazing to use. i used this in the rain and it was great, however the lens can get foggy at times (I understand this is normal) but it affects the pictures. And you need to make sure you clean it well after every water use to avoid water stain on the lens which you will see in each picture until cleaned. I like the GPS feature which lets you know where you took the photos, but it seems to stay on even after you turn the camera off.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from Panasonic!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a TS3 and the camera has been reasonable. The lens fogs in cold weather but otherwise ok until this week. I pulled it out for a ski trip and found the battery was dead. I thought that was unusual as I had recently charged it. I pulled the battery and put it in the charger. It indicated the battery was fully charged and didn't do more. After using the USB cable to charge the battery it became evident that the charger wasn't operating correctly. Being in the warranty period I called Panasonic and they are refusing to cover the charger under the warranty even though it is included in the warranty documents as a covered item.
customer_reviews.author: I B

customer_reviews.title: STURDY, nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: I scuba, spearfish and surf. I've had this thing under to 60ft still with no problems. It is built like a little tank and takes really nice photos. It is very quick to use: boots from off to on very fast, plus it has a picture button and a separate movie record button which makes things really easy esp under water when you don't want to fuss with switching modes, etc. Simple, sturdy. Prob the best underwater dig camera of its type, yet.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this waterproof camera for you ocean people!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! Lasting me for years and takes great pictures. Very easy to use and I enjoy all the different modes. I have a new model of the Panasonic for work and it is just as great with a few upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: LMSHIZU

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Loved this camera. I just use my phone now for most photos... but used this camera a lot for hiking and bad weather environments... and under water. It was a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: loved, loved, loved this camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm so thankful i bought this camera before my trip. I'm thinking of buying one for my whole family before we take a family cruise in a few weeks. We brought it with us on a trip to the Bahamas. They gave us a free Vivitar 'waterproof' camera as a sales incentive gift. It didn't work. This camera was awesome. The camera took great pictures both above and below water. I'm so tickled with the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: joy to the world

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and handy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this compact and durable camera a few years ago and it continues to serve me well. Handles winter adventure temps to summer snorkeling with ease. Lots of menu options allows one to go beyond point and shot programming to get great sunset, night sky, close up, etc shots. Easy fit into pocket or small belt bag for ready access.
customer_reviews.author: VT Fly

customer_reviews.title: I ended up having to send my first one to ...
customer_reviews.text: I ended up having to send my first one to the warranty center because it got water in it the fist time I went snorkeling with it. They sent me another one and it did the same thing. They sent me another one (Black instead of Rust), however, I am a little apprehensive to try use it in water!
customer_reviews.author: James Boozer

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof.
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera under water while snorkeling. It stopped working within minutes. I checked the latch before using it and after. It was closed and locked. I sent it back to Panasonic but they would not honer the warranty and wanted almost $200 dollars to fix it. They said water got into it so it's not under warranty. I'll never buy another Panasonic product.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera when i was going on a cruise and at the time i had compared it with the GoPro and it was a better option at the time. GoPro was more video and i wanted more photo while still being able to shoot HD video at 1080p. Now, 3 years later i ended up getting a GoPro 3+ Black edition but I still have my Panasonic Lumix and won't get rid of it, I love this camera because the the quality of the video and the pictures are great! The GoPro i use as an action camera but when not doing sports, casual or going places i take my Lumix.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Del Valle

customer_reviews.title: love
customer_reviews.text: exactly what it is meant to do! yay! love it
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this camera!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera to use underwater. My husband took it diving to about 6 feet and took 4 picutures with him and his buddies and IT DIED. We did everything that was recommended by checking the seal and making sure it was water tight before and it still stopped working. It was only the 2nd time we turned it on, so we sent it in for warranty repair through Panasonic. Here's the kicker- the warranty work is going to cost me $180!! No thank you. Panasonic can keep this horrible money trap and I'm going to go with another, more reputable brand. Those 4 pictures cost me $75 each. AVOID THIS!
customer_reviews.author: DAFXRX

customer_reviews.title: Poor warranty service.
customer_reviews.text: Leaked after using on vacation for about a week. Followed all procedures for cleaning after each use as per manual. Panasonic refused warranty coverage saying that I was at fault somehow. Very bad customer service so I avoid there products now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a water proof camera to take to my vacation. At first I was skeptical since I read that some of the cameras have a seal problem. Luckily mine did not have any issues and it works great. I do have to say that sometimes you have to play around with the settings for pictures not to be over expos or have the right colors.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: good water proof camera
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good Looks Good Zoom easy to use, description on features with in the interface supports SDXC cards excellent 1080 HD recording used it in Beach, worked perfectly more than 30 modes to take pictures pictures come in very good quality I was able to take around 250 pictures with out switching off the camera in between in a span of 3 hours. cons: GPS start up is slow and consumes lot of battery power
customer_reviews.author: Vinod

customer_reviews.title: Takes decent images, but the battery doesn't last very ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes decent images, but the battery doesn't last very long - which is a problem when it's wet and you can't open it to change them out. First one sprung a leak right away and died. Panasonic fully replaced it and the second has been water tight ever since.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Works fine (so far)
customer_reviews.text: I have not dropped it to test that feature, neither have I taken it underwater (yet). However it generally takes good pictures, and is quick to respond. However, the user interface is confusing and the manual (pdf) does not help much. Also the pictures are a little soft - but the reviews told me that. Also I'm comparing it to a higher quality camera. But it takes really good movies - so much so that I might abandon my video camera.
customer_reviews.author: ValhallaSystems

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the Audio
customer_reviews.text: Great camera but the audio in videos had a lot of noise when the camera focuses on moving subjects.
customer_reviews.author: B. Herder

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely stoked
customer_reviews.text: By far and away the best compact digital I have brought for my travels. I am aware I can get ones that will take better pictures, however balances need to be made with regards to environments etc, and did a lot of research prior to purchasing. This camera is living up to every bit of it's reviews and ratings as 'best in class'.
customer_reviews.author: GARTH STEPHENS

customer_reviews.title: GOOD CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Good Camera. Tough and waterproof. Used it for fishing/kayaking/tubing/the beach/boating/ice fishing/hunting and I've had zero problems with it. It take good pictures and movies. The display screen on the camera doesn't do the actual pictures justice. So if they look low quality on the camera don't worry.
customer_reviews.author: CHILLINTHEMOST

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this camera and Panasonic. The camera stopped working the first day my daughter received it(she's 25). Which just happened to be Chritmas, bad timing. I called Panasonic for help, after an hour on the phone. I was told i had to send the camera back. I was told i would receive the camera back in 7-10 days, that was 3 weeks ago. Panasonic called me and said they were still working on it. I asked for a new camera and was told NO! Panasonic does not replace them. I had to wait for it to be fixed. I'm still waiting.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Only used it underwater once, but the image is great! The GPS was kind of slow to update, but since the last firmware upgrade (look for it at Panasonic site!!!) it is great... This is my camera #2 right now... the one I take when I don't want to walk around with my nikon D3100 on my neck!
customer_reviews.author: Hardy Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Incredible camera!  Does everything you ask of it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best waterproof digital cameras I have ever used. It has gone with us on every vacation and has always preformed incredibly well! We have been snorkeling in the Caribbean and on lots of beaches. We never have to worry about our camera. This thing takes incredible pictures and video and we could not be more pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Good waterproof camera for extreme elements
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, yep. Otherwise pictures are a bit grainy. Trying to get a normal picture in sunshine conditions was difficult. Just didn't seem to have good quality. Make sure to take care of instructions on taking care of the camera after submerged in water to maintain the waterproof structure as well as prevent mineral buildups.
customer_reviews.author: M. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great camera...totally recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take on a trip to St. Kitts-- I took my big fancy camera and this camera and ended up taking all my pictures with this camera-- it does great and its in and under water functions are awesome! I've just started using this camera for all my picture taking needs! Headed to Turks this fall and can't wait to use it then :) I totally recommend this camera for anyone looking for a digital camera that is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: amb0427

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Had the camera less than 2 days and took it for a test in the pool. 5 pictures later the camera died. Found condensation inside the lens and LCD screen. Panasonic would not cover the warranty stating that water damage is not covered. I had made sure to follow all instructions carefully. I will use my GoPro Hero2 for my vacation. The pictures may not be a good as those taken by the TS3 but atleast I know that it can handle being submerged unlike the TS3.
customer_reviews.author: Fastdrive

customer_reviews.title: Great Underwater Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this camera for several days. Takes great pictures in the pool and am sure it will be a great companion for snorkeling. Even got some decent fireworks pictures and video using the Fireworks mode! Obviously the picture quality isn't quite as good as I get with my DSLR but this fills a different niche for me. It is portable and seems pretty indestructible (meaning we'll actually take it places and not be constantly worried that it's going to be ruined). The software has a lot of different shooting modes which I'm just starting to explore, but it looks like there are plenty of options to get the right shot for whatever I am trying to do.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Crawford

customer_reviews.title: It is a very complete and very good designed for water chamber that was what I was ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a very complete and very good designed for water chamber that was what I was looking With GPS and many very useful features, but lacks some zoom, but its favor is that it is not designed for that.
customer_reviews.author: Edison Loza

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this camera after looking around for a while. I used to own a pentax optima (~4 yr old). The biggest problem of the optima was a slow shutter speed, which seemed to be a common problem among waterproof cameras at that time. Some recent models have the same problem. I bought a Fujifilm Finepix waterproof camera recently and had to ship it back because I didn't like its slow focus & shutter issue. Lumix's is great at this. No frustration of missing critical moments. I have used it under water several times without any problems. Overall, I am very satisfied with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: mymyzoo

customer_reviews.title: buy a different one
customer_reviews.text: not great build quality, the internal shutter for the image sensor or whatever blacks out the image gets stuck...frequently, requires a firm tap on a semi-hard surface
customer_reviews.author: Chris Staley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that could go surfing with me. I wanted a camera to go snowboarding with me. I needed a camera I did not have to worry about breaking or drowning. This is the perfect fit. It has been 2 years and it still works great with no issues. It takes amazing pictures and I find that I have my camera more often then my Wife with her big ole professional one because it is durable and easy to bring with me everywhere. No complaints great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gam3rHav3n

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: This camera was worth every dollar. Very durable, completely waterproof, great picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Starring

customer_reviews.title: Great all around camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I bought it for our cruise so I could have something in the water. I've used it on 4 vacations now. Takes great underwater pictures and also regular shots. It's my go to camera for vacations. I also bought a float wrist strap.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Poor picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I am not satisfied with the picture quality. I take pictures outside - mostly landscapes, and the pictures turn out blurry or grainy. I have been taking pictures for a while with different cameras so am not a newbie. Really think this camera is not as good as a Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera!
customer_reviews.text: My wife will be living in Hawaii for a few years so we decided to get a point and shoot that can take pictures and video under water. We were very satisfied with the quality of the pictures and video we took while snorkeling. We go out with some friends and take video and come straight home to watch the footage on the tv. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: drich8

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for underwater pictures on our vacation. You have to be VERY still (which is difficult when water is splashing against you) but the camera performed beautifully. We followed all the guidelines for rinsing after using in saltwater and pool water and haven't had any problems. I don't find it quite as easy to use as our other camera, but my husband likes it.
customer_reviews.author: a reader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1 year, then flooded
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little camera capturing incredible underwater and on land pictures (for its size.) Then, exactly 1 year after the purchase I was using the camera in a controlled pool environment and it flooded. If this is an anomaly, then the camera is great, but beware.
customer_reviews.author: T. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: VERY durable! excellent image quality. Bought this camera to take pictures while contracting in Afghanistan. its on its second deployment and works great. other cameras have been destroyed by sand, dust, rain etc etc. this one is still going strong! Strongly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Norman

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera for our upcoming trip to Florida. It works great out of water and in. We used it just floating in the ocean, on a snorkeling/kayak trip and a jet ski trip. Not having to worry about running out of film or your camera being submerged is worth the money. The pictures on the right settings in the right light come out just about as well as a DSLR. The iAuto settings do leave a bit to be desired but there are other settings you can choose for better results. We also dropped it once on pavement, with no problems. This is a great camera for any water sports or to just throw in your bag anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great for water and snow and all outside shots
customer_reviews.text: This camera works great for what I bought it for...Snowboarding. The bonus is that its very cool to take underwater pics as well. The only downside i can think of is that indoor and low-light shots can be very challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice digital camera, the shock and water proof features are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful camera. Easy to use, great photos. I was able to use it almost immediately on fully automatic and with specific modes (such as sunset). Read the manual or play with it for a few minutes to learn how to navigate the modes. Sunsets are hard pictures to capture, but with this camera, the pictures came out better than an amateur like me can do with an SRL. I know this is silly, but a WIFI chip to network the pictures to my PC or a website would be a great addition. I kept looking for that function, until I realized this is only a camera.
customer_reviews.author: DroidFan

customer_reviews.title: Decent for a ruggedized camera
customer_reviews.text: Typical Lumix behavior: great performance in natural/outdoor light, and adequate snapshots indoors and in low-light (expected graininess and contrast issues at higher ISOs). So far the camera has survived bumps and drops, and a thorough bath during a kayak day trip on choppy (fresh) water. I'm comfortable carrying it everywhere in the back of my bag without fear that it will be crushed by books, electronics, etc. My biggest gripe is the proprietary battery from Panasonic. Either use standard battery sizes or at very least a standard Lumix battery. I don't mind paying a premium for a decent camera but the margin on essentially required OEM accessories is harder to stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Packer

customer_reviews.title: great versatile camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something I could take to the outdoors and not have to worry about. Even in the rain I can leave this strapped to a shoulder strap and worry about ruining it or knocking it around. The pictures look great and the interface is responsive and pretty intuitive. I wondered if the thicker lens housing might make shots slightly less crisp than a non-ruggedized version, but not because I wished the pictures were better. I even managed to take a picture of some maps and book passages and view them in the screen so as not to ruin the paper copies in the rain! It still looks and works as new and I expect will last quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Burns

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the right price.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this camera until it was stolen. The replacements are even better. If you got a great deal on this one it is a great camera. If not a great deal, go for the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: BayKayaking

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, poor software
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera but the software is not very user friendly. the Firmware update is none. the newer model have the same specs, changes only the software which u can do time laps pics and other functions. I wish they can upgrade the software in this model too so I dont need to buy an identical device just for a additional function.
customer_reviews.author: Mango110

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera, but does not work well indoors
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera - good design, all buttons and features are easy to access but the pictures do not come out sharp. In-doors, one always needs to use the flash - which is slow and leaves pictures either saturated. The focus is also sub optimal. THe camera does look rugged and there is tons of warnings about locking both doors. The warning about sand is nice, but it appears EVERYWHERE, so it gives the message that this is a design flaw, rather than a system element. I used the camera for a bit and then returned it - just want not taking sharp pictures inside. All the images looked very fuzzy...
customer_reviews.author: WaterColors

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Camera! Garbage Service!
customer_reviews.text: This camera broke IMMEDIATELY upon touching even the slightest bit of water. It was two weeks old! Panasonic claims that it was MY FAULT that their underwater camera leaked, and they refuse to honor the warranty. No explanation, just: "this camera failed the leak test, it is out of warranty." I opened the hatch ONCE to insert the memory card, and I did so with the directions right in front of me. I WILL NEVER AGAIN DO BUSINESS WITH PANASONIC. NEVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Jonson

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: USed underwaer and it works, both video and pictures. We went snorkling in the Bahamas and in the Philippines and it is still working. Even the zoom works
customer_reviews.author: AQS

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I meticulously followed the instructions and the camera remained watertight for several uses in swimming pools. Snorkeling here in Maui down to 20 feet was a different story. After the dive, the camera started to complain with messages like "cannot play video" and then stopped working. After opening the door there was noticeable water inside. Also once the door was opened, the lens fogged up. Now, the camera is completely dead. I own a few Panasonic cameras ... If they honor their warranty on this one, fine. Else, I'll never purchase another Lumix. In the meantime, I'll have to rent an underwater camera on this trip.
customer_reviews.author: ds

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my purchase. I bought the camera before a trip to Italy and the pictures turned out fantastic. The video quality is great as well. I only used the for a few underwater pictures but it held it's own. The only thing I wanted additionally was the panorama shot where you hold down the button and simply turn the camera. All in all it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, it is a Ppiece of Junk - not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my daughter as a gift for Christmas. Was not till the summer that we have started using it. Always locking the battery door and following the instructions. Used it for a couple minutes and it may be okay but in the pool for 1 hour and suddenly you will see water on the inside of the screen and then flickering and black. It dries out but it is not right. Others have given the same feedback. Amazon only offers a brief return policy, not even a 1 year warranty. Stuck with a $260 boat anchor... Something to think about. I'm a loyal Amazon customer but this gives me pause... Hope this helps others.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but zero mac support!
customer_reviews.text: This camera take gorgrous shots and videos, especially when using the enchanced settings such as "Happy mode". The separate buttons for taking videos and shots is an ingenious idea. It does take a bit of time to start capturing video though. The menus and features are well explained but different functionalities are accessed via one of "mode", "menu" or "q.menu/trash" buttons -- however, it's not entirely intuitive which one contains the function you're looking for. The software included works only on a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron N Wong

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. I took it on land and it took great shots. The camera writes really fast,much faster than any other camera. The pics are very clear... I took it underwater maybe 45ft no leaks and great pics.
customer_reviews.author: WLP21

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This camera has become our go to vacation beach device!
customer_reviews.author: DREi22

customer_reviews.title: Dust-proof, too.
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to camera for trips into dusty environments, such as the desert. It's also been fun to play with at the pool, although in-water use is just a bonus for me. The GPS can be a little slow to lock onto your location, but if you have the patience you'll get tagged photos which are great for reconstructing routes and setups once you're back at a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Baughman

customer_reviews.title: Great thus far
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this camera for about one month and couldn't be more happy. The settings and scene selection are easy to adjust. This camera takes great pictures. I especially like that it has a 'baby' scene that tracks the name and age of the subject. I did not have a chance to test the underwater features yet. Hopefully I won't have to re-rate this product after using this camera under water.
customer_reviews.author: sonicspear

customer_reviews.title: didn't expect it to be so good
customer_reviews.text: A gem to use, much easier to set up than my previous Lumix model I had. Picture quality crystal clear. Sharing to TV screen simple with HDMI cable(extra-not included) but worth getting.
customer_reviews.author: Amr Marzouk

customer_reviews.title: Takes awesome pictures.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to go to Hawaii. We used it every day to snorkel with. I even forgot to latch the safety latch for hours once, and it was fine. When the water was clear it took some great shots! Out of the water it took some wonderful ones as well. I have a couple that look like they have been edited that I have never touched. Over all very impressed with how well it is holding up, the quality, and the options on this camera. This is our first under water camera so I may not know a lot about them, but the reviews scared me. No need to have worried.
customer_reviews.author: aj8264

customer_reviews.title: Nice vacation camera
customer_reviews.text: Took this to Turks and Caicos and it worked out great. Only thing I didnt like was when water droplets on the lens would distort the images. Of course im sure this is a problem with all underwater cameras that get wet. Many neat software additions make this a fun camera. The seperate video button is awesome. I would only use this camera in well lit situations. They didnt include a silicon case so I had to order one from Canada. Not sure why the US doesnt have it yet. It came with a floaty that says Lumix too. This will be my go to camera when on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: 2nd use leaked and ruined even though I followed instructions carefully. Just over 1 year old  :(
customer_reviews.text: Worked great except it leaked on 2nd use. 1st use worked fine, I followed instructions and also put in fresh water afterward. I had an Olympus before this and the Panasonic did take better pictures but this doesn't help if it doesn't stand up to its advertised purpose. Of course it is now out of warranty even though it is only 1.5 years. FAIL Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: nicksta

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: bought this camera based on past panasonic cameras and the ratings it has. overall its a great purchase. i bought this for snorkling on a recent cruise. my only gripe is that i missed several shots cause i didnt know the camera was off while underwater. its hard to see through a mask as it is and i was basically pointing and shooting at everything. i missed some fire coral and urchins but thats all. i also kept puching the on/off button instead of the take picture button.
customer_reviews.author: digitalknoll

customer_reviews.title: Tough and Incredible
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera to use on 1 of our wildland fire trucks that operate a cross the country, am glad we did. The photos are clear and the option of having GPS information on each photo is a benefit in our line of work. The camera is easy to use and the battery life is very good. We did purchase some cut to fit screen protectors as we are rough on equipment. Overall we are very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: BCWF

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Used in snorkeling and horseback riding on a cruise. Had no issues with waterproof or anything. A great choice if you are looking for some light water use and an outdoors type camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: Great underwater shots. Good in low light. Battery life is not great even under low energy settings. Otherwise it would be 5 stars. Video was decent as well. Very rugged. Took lots of beach shots and in the surf then cleaned off easy by soaking it at home.
customer_reviews.author: milvt

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Overall Not Just Underwater
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased camera and used for both general and underwater applications. Big surprise was that it worked very well for low light situations. The image was excellent at even 3200. Having a separate video and mode buttion make the camera easy to use. It appears to work as well or better in general applications than my new Canon 300 HS. Recommend it very highly but have only one week of use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast and refuses to die. And the color quality is quite nice for a "rugged" camera, of which I have had others.
customer_reviews.author: jbsd

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years, died at a bad time
customer_reviews.text: OK, so reading the 1-star reviews I consider myself lucky that this expensive camera lasted 2 whole years. Of course, it died in the middle of a vacation where I wanted to take pictures snorkeling, and couldn't. I had it in the ocean once before, and it was used many times in the pool, but it died within minutes of it's second trip to the ocean. It was never deeper than 10', and it died in 3' of water. The seals were clean, and undamaged, so they just don't last (and when you look at the seals, even when new, it's a miracle they would ever work.)
customer_reviews.author: Ken W.

customer_reviews.title: Great all round camera
customer_reviews.text: I have being using this camera for over a year and it is great! Still use it in the pool and in the rain on our dog walks to the beach. I do not leave the house without it. I use it to document the restoration if my truck and it gets quite a beating in the shop.Great durable camera. I wish it had a better zoom but I guess you can't have it all
customer_reviews.author: Gerrrit61

customer_reviews.title: Solid Feel - GPS So So
customer_reviews.text: This Lumix feels well made and, in fact, is made in Japan! While pictures and video clips are on par with most good point-and-shoot cameras there are issues. 1) The battery life is poor. Count on 100 photos of normal use. 2) The GPS is hit or miss. Don't count on your pictures being geo tagged. So, if battery life and GPS don't matter to you buy the DMC-TS3. You will have a rugged water proof camera that takes good pics.
customer_reviews.author: CraigShipp.com

customer_reviews.title: Discontinued model.
customer_reviews.text: Discontinued model. This never leaked but I'm very careful with the seals and keep them covered with a slight amount of Divers Silocone paste.
customer_reviews.author: Rick In NorthEast

customer_reviews.title: What it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after doing quite a bit of homework. This camera went to the Florida Keys with us. We took it snorkeling twice and it took amazing video and stills. This is a great camera if you are an outdoorsy person. You must follow the instructions on how to keep it clean and waterproof. Don't think you don't have to. If you slack on that, you will be one of those disappointed purchasers.
customer_reviews.author: Monique P.

customer_reviews.title: The best point and shot i ever had !!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! Take pictures magnificent! The picture quality is phenomenal. Video recorded underwater was amazing. I recommend this camera too, was the best I've ever bought ! Very well done Panasonic !! Congratulations !! I'm very pleased with it !!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Venosa Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy photos
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. He loves it. Says its really easy to use, doesn't make mistakes. He takes it fishing and the red color is easy to find against the white boat interior, and when fish is caught, taking the picture is a quick no brainer. Once home, its easy to load photos onto computer and send them out to friends and family. Also great to have in and around the swimming pool. Have recommended to others who need waterproof camera.
customer_reviews.author: lakewood gator

customer_reviews.title: This camera died on our vacation
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for our yearly vacation to Outer banks of NC. I read the instructions carefully before taking the camera to the beach. I didn't even go into the water completely but the camera got wet while taking couple of shots. That is it. The camera just froze and died. Had to return it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MANIS

customer_reviews.title: This is a very durable and easy to use camera and video camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a very durable and easy to use camera and video camera. Have not used it underwater much.
customer_reviews.author: L. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Ótima câmera para o dia dia
customer_reviews.text: Ótima câmera. As fotos na função automática são muito boas, me surpreendi com as fotos em ambientes escuros. Tem uma diversidade de recursos, para os mais entendidos e curiosos, que pode deixar a imagem ainda melhor. O GPS demora cerca de 15 minutos para se localizar. Ela é um pouco maior que outras da mesma categoria, porém a qualidade da imagem é melhor. O botão de disparo de fotos responde com uma velocidade muito boa. Em síntese é excelente uma camera para vc não se preocupar onde vai guarda-la quando tiver na praia, na piscina, em festas, com crianças...
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous using an underwater digital camera after reading many negative reviews of water leaking or lower quality pictures. However, this was not the case with this camera. I admit that I am quite ameteur at photography, but with this camera we got beautiful, clear pictures. We took it to two Hawaiin islands and had no worry of fog or leaking. We made sure to follow the instructions to avoid problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: it ok
customer_reviews.text: This camera is waterprook yes, which is nice to have but it does not take very good pictures when it is not in the water. look elsewhere for a better quality picture.
customer_reviews.author: pokat

customer_reviews.title: Decent camera, broke after being underwater
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera for about two years. During this time, it took great pictures above water and underwater (e.g., pool). I have been happy with performance. Recently, it was dropped onto the beach when getting out of a kayak. At that time, water got into the camera and it no longer turns on. My theory is that the water seal rings deteriorated over time. So, be careful putting it underwater after you've had it for a while. Given the price I paid for it, I am disappointed that it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Rajo

customer_reviews.title: Main reason to get it was for the GPS signature
customer_reviews.text: ... And that is the feature which seldom works. (Under open skies, I should add.) While the camera was under warranty, I called about the inability to lock onto satellites. They recommended complete factory reset, which somehow works, but not always and of course, all the various settings made and already forgotten about, ale lost. It certainly is a good camera for taking pictures, but since I did get it because of the GPS and that is disappointing, I cannot rate it very high.
customer_reviews.author: Josip Juraj Strossmayer

customer_reviews.title: Good transaction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my grandson as a Christmas present. He opened it, read the directions (he is 13), and has hardly put it down since then. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Hough

customer_reviews.title: awsome!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awsome, it is so nice and so rugged,love it! U won't be dissapointed in this camera! I am so glad i bought this camera!
customer_reviews.author: eslonger

customer_reviews.title: I never have time to review anything and buy so much
customer_reviews.text: I just came back from 5 days in the Caymans with this camera and my canon SLR. I snorkeled, dove in amazing reefs. Came back with so many awesome underwater pictures. I travel all over and buy at least four camera's a year. I never thought from a Panasonic I would get great quality pictures of sting rays, reefs, fish and sunsets. Great buy get wrist band with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gee G

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 12.1 MP Rugged/Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)
feature_bullets: 4 Active Outdoor Scene Modes: The DMC-TS3 has 4 active outdoor Scene Modes - Sports, Snow, Beach & Snorkeling and Underwater
LEICA DC Lens with Folded Optics Technology: The DMC-TS3 features a high-quality LEICA DC VARIO-ELMAR 28mm wide-angle lens
28mm Wide-angle Lens: The 28mm wide-angle lens lets you easily capture large groups of people indoors
Newly Developed 12.1-megapixel Hi-speed CCD: The newly developed 12.1-megapixel CCD with 2-channel signal
Sonic Speed AF: The Sonic Speed AF system includes numerous re-engineering enhancements
